content.rendered:
2024 Summer Games Venues in Paris

For the 2024 Summer Games, Paris’s event venues have been primarily divided into two main zones: Grand Paris Zone and Paris Centre Zone. The majority of the venues are pre-existing, with minimal new construction required. A total of 24 (of 32) sports are located within 10 kilometers of the Olympic Village, making things very convenient for anyone attending these Summer Games.

Grand Paris Zone Venues

  • Yves-du-Manoir Stadium – Hockey
  • Stade de France – Opening and Closing Ceremonies, Athletics, Rugby
  • La Défense Arena – Swimming, Water Polo Finals
  • La Chapelle Arena – Badminton, Rhythmic Gymnastics
  • Aquatics Centre – Water Polo Preliminaries, Artistic Swimming, Diving
  • Le Bourget Sport Climbing Venue – Sport Climbing
  • La Courneuve Shooting Range – Shooting

Paris Centre Zone Venues

  • Parc de Princes – Football
  • Roland Garros Stadium – Tennis, Boxing
  • South Paris Arena 1 – Volleyball
  • South Paris Arena 4 – Table Tennis
  • South Paris Arena 6 – Basketball Preliminaries, Weightlifting
  • Bercy Arena – Basketball Finals, Artistic
    Gymnastics, Trampoline
  • Grand Palais – Fencing, Taekwondo
  • La Concorde – 3×3 Basketball, Breaking, BMX Freestyle, Skateboarding
  • Pont D’Iéna – Marathon Swimming, Marathon, Race Walk, Road Cycling, Triathlon
  • Champ de Mars Arena – Judo, Wrestling
  • Eiffel Tower Stadium – Beach Volleyball
  • Les Invalides – Archery

Outside Venues

  • Pierre-Mauroy Stadium, Lille – Handball
  • Vaires-Sur-Marne Nautical Stadium, Vairessur-Marne – Rowing, Canoe-Kayak Sprint, Canoe-Kayak Slalom
  • Vélodrome National and BMX Stadium, SaintQuentin-en-Yvelines – Track Cycling, Modern Pentathlon, BMX Racing
  • Parc Olympique Lyonnais, Lyon – Football
  • Parc de Princes, Paris – Football
  • Matmut Atlantique, Bordeaux – Football
  • Geoffroy-Guichard Stadium, Saint-Étienne – Football
  • Allianz Riviera, Nice – Football
  • Stade de la Beaujoire, Nantes – Football
  • Elancourt Hill, Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines – Mountain Biking
  • Golf National, Guyancourt – Golf
  • Château de Versailles, Versailles – Modern Pentathlon, Equestrian
  • Port de la Pointe Rouge, Marseille – Sailing
  • Debarcadere Teahupoo, Tahiti – Surfing
